intro: Carduus thoermeri, commonly known as the Thörmers' thistle, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows and along roadsides. It has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in various environmental conditions. Its flowers are visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance.
